title: Hearty Beef & Veggie Pasta
description: A classic, comforting pasta dish that uses your ground beef and pantry staples.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the onion, carrots, and celery and cook until softened, about 10 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for another minute.
Add the ground beef and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon. Drain any excess fat.
Add the canned tomatoes, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for at least 30 minutes, or longer for a richer sauce.
While the sauce is simmering, cook the pasta according to package directions.
Serve the sauce over the pasta, topped with Parmesan cheese.

title: Creamy Tomato Chicken
description: A rich and creamy chicken dish that's quick to make.
ingredients: 1 (14.5 oz) can Diced Tomatoes (or use your Canned Tomatoes)
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Season the chicken with salt and pepper and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove from the skillet.
In the same skillet, add the onion and cook until softened. Add the garlic and cook for another minute.
Pour in the heavy cream and diced tomatoes. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes, until the sauce has thickened slightly.
Stir in the cooked chicken. Serve hot.

title: Simple Lasagna
description: A simplified lasagna recipe that uses some of the leftover ingredients.
ingredients: Leftover pasta sauce from Day 1 (if any)
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Cook the lasagna noodles according to package directions.
In a small bowl, mix together the ricotta cheese and egg.
Spread a thin layer of pasta sauce in the bottom of a baking dish.
Layer with noodles, then the ricotta mixture, then mozzarella, then sauce. Repeat the layers until you run out of ingredients, ending with a layer of sauce topped with mozzarella and Parmesan.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the top is golden and bubbly.
